intro: Eubrachion arnottii, commonly known as the Arnott's thistle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers form dense, spherical clusters. Eubrachion arnottii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
